newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Richter firms after Thursday's IPO pricing.
newsitem.headline: Richter firms after Thursday's IPO pricing.

text.p: Shares in pharmaceuticals maker Richter Gedeon Rt traded higher on the Budapest Stock Exchange on Friday following a pricing procedure on Thursday in the second phase of its sell-off.
At 1043 GMT Richter stood at 14,640 forints, up 400 from Thursday's close of 14,240.
Richter firmed on the SEAQ as well and at 0824 GMT it was marked at $80, up from Thursay's close of $79.25 and also up from $79.50 at the opening.
"Richter's rise is clear related to its share issue price which caused some surprise to the market due to the small discount from the market price," one trader said.
On Thursday the price of the private placement and the following public offer in the second phase of Richter's sell-off was set at $78 and 14,160.
The private placement was four and a half times oversubscribed.

In the private placement 2.6 million shares, partly sold by privatisation agency APV Rt, partly issued by the company, were offered to institutional investors. In a domestic public offer which starts next Tuesday, a further 200,000 shares will be available.
